title: Google\Cloud\Sql\V1beta4\MySqlReplicaConfiguration
name: MySqlReplicaConfiguration
description:
Read-replica configuration specific to MySQL databases.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.sql.v1beta4.MySqlReplicaConfiguration

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.dump_file_path
params.description: Path to a SQL dump file in Google Cloud Storage from which the replica instance is to be created. The URI is in the form gs://bucketName/fileName. Compressed gzip files (.gz) are also supported. Dumps have the binlog co-ordinates from which replication begins. This can be accomplished by setting --master-data to 1 when using mysqldump.

params.name: data.username
params.description: The username for the replication connection.

params.name: data.password
params.description: The password for the replication connection.

params.name: data.connect_retry_interval
params.description: Seconds to wait between connect retries. MySQL's default is 60 seconds.

params.name: data.master_heartbeat_period
params.description: Interval in milliseconds between replication heartbeats.

params.name: data.ca_certificate
params.description: PEM representation of the trusted CA's x509 certificate.

params.name: data.client_certificate
params.description: PEM representation of the replica's x509 certificate.

params.name: data.client_key
params.description: PEM representation of the replica's private key. The corresponsing public key is encoded in the client's certificate.

params.name: data.ssl_cipher
params.description: A list of permissible ciphers to use for SSL encryption.

params.name: data.verify_server_certificate
params.description: Whether or not to check the primary instance's Common Name value in the certificate that it sends during the SSL handshake.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: This is always sql#mysqlReplicaConfiguration.

methods.name: getDumpFilePath
methods.description:
Path to a SQL dump file in Google Cloud Storage from which the replica instance is to be created. The URI is in the form gs://bucketName/fileName.

Compressed gzip files (.gz) are also supported. Dumps have the binlog co-ordinates from which replication begins. This can be accomplished by setting --master-data to 1 when using mysqldump.

Generated from protobuf field string dump_file_path = 1;

methods.description:

Generated from protobuf field string dump_file_path = 1;
